hanzi-su-wiki:
契

Значения

Клясться, обещать

Мнемоника

Контракт, купчая. Большой человек 大 при заключении контракта ведёт счёт, делая ножом 刀 на дощечке зарубки.
purpleculture_pinyin:
qì
to carve; carved words; to agree; a contract; a deed
вырезать; резные слова; Соглашаться; контракт; дело
rtega_mnemonic:
契契RSdeed, contract, bond, engrave
  • RS. a contract 㓞 between men 大
purpleculture_info: Ideographic: A contract signed by cutting 刀 notches 丰 in wood 木 (now changed to 大)
purpleculture_examples:
契机 [ qì jī ]: opportunity; turning point; juncture
契约 [ qì yuē ]: agreement; contract
默契 [ mò qì ]: tacit understanding; mutual understanding; rapport; connected at a deep level with each other; (of team members) well coordinated; tight
契丹 [ qì dān ]: Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 辽河
契合 [ qì hé ]: agreement; to agree; to get on with; congenial; agreeing with; to ally oneself with sb
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • ⿰ Left to right
      • 丰 [ fēng ] abundant, lush, bountiful, plenty
      • 刀 [ dāo ] knife; old coin; measure
    • 大 [ dà ] big, great, vast, high, deep
heisig_chinese_memo: Imagine a totalitarian regime where, while growing up, you have to sign contracts and pledge allegiance to the flag at dagger-point with St. Bernard guard dogs watching you and thorny bushes to stop you from running.
heisig_constituent: pledge, flick knife, grow up, dagger, large, St. Bernard
heisig_story: Grow up . . . dagger . . . St. Bernard dog. The connotation of this character should be kept distinct from that for vow (Frame 1214) and promise (Frame 1462).
koohiiStory1: Imagine a totalitarian regime where, while growing up, you have to pledge allegiance to the flag at dagger-point and with St. Bernard guard dogs watching you.
koohiiStory2: In order to pledge into her sorority, Alice had to stab a St. Bernard with a dagger. (Come on! DO it, Alice!).
jp_example_words:
契機(けいき): opportunity, chance
契る(ちぎる): to pledge, to promise, to swear
契約(けいやく): contract, compact, agreement
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The weight of life on your sword is big when you pledge to protect your city. That's the big, big weight of every single person's life in that city pressing down on you every time you take out that sword.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine holding up your sword and pledging to protect the lives of everyone in this city. It's a big deal!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Until the city is safe, you pledge to give up cake (けい), your favorite food.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Would you pledge to give up cake to show everyone how serious you are about protecting life?
Ru_Radicals: 亠 (крышка), 刀 (катана), 土 (земля), 大 (большой)
Ru_trainchinese: qì: (графема) договор, соглашение; соглашаться, быть в согласии; (книжн.) гравировать; (книжн.) выгравированные иероглифы
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the master with the sword (㓞) makes a big (大) pledge
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Imagine a totalitarian regime where, while growing up, you have to sign contracts and pledge allegiance to the flag at dagger-point with St. Bernard guard dogs watching you and thorny bushes to stop you from running.
humanum_full_description_en:
From "㓞" from " big ". Beginning of the text as "㓞", after the increase " big next to" make " deed " or by " wood next to" make " carve ." Ancient books " carve ", " contract " universal no other. See "㓞", "栔".

" Deed " means a moment. "Release name. "Shishuqi": "The contract, engrave. Engrave know its number." Such as "Poetry. Daya. "Mian": "Yuan begins to make a plan, and I agree with my tortoise." Zheng Xuanjian: "Let's burn the tortoise and divination." "Lu's Spring and Autumn. "Cha Jin": "Chu people have those who wade through the river, and their swords fell into the water from the boat, and the boat suddenly said: "It is where my sword falls.""

"Book Deed" was originally a kind of voucher and token in ancient times. It is usually made in two copies, with words written on both slips, and the two are joined together, and a certain number of teeth are engraved on one side, and each of the parties will hold one as proof of verification. (Refer to Lin Yuan) "Zhou Li. Local official Situ. "Pledger": "The book deed in Zhangji City is the same as its measurement, and one has its own integrity." Zheng Xuan's note: "The book deed is a coupon to be given to the market. The image of the coupon is two books, and the side is carved. ""Lao Tzu. Chapter Seventy-Nine": "The saint holds the contract without blaming others."

" Deed " by extension means a contractual document. Such as "Zhou Li. Heaven official tomb. "Xiaozai": "Liu said, "Listen to give a written contract." Also refers to an agreement. Such as "Han Shiwai Biography. Volume VI: "A promise is made, but there is no day for it."

" Qi " also means harmony and harmony. Such as "Selected Works. Cao Zijian's "Seven Qi": "Xuanhua participates in the gods, and is in harmony with the spirit." Emperor Liang Jianwen of the Southern Dynasty "Song of the Southern Suburbs": "The ministers hear the sky as the great, the saints respect his virtues, know how many gods, and even people agree with him. Tao." Also refers to like-minded people. For example, Tao Qian of the Eastern Jin Dynasty "Peach Blossom Spring Poem": "I wish to keep the breeze clear and hold high to find my deeds."

" Qi " is the ancestor of the legendary merchant. "Historical Records. "Yin Benji": "Yin Qi, the mother called Jian Di, and the daughter of the La family, who was the second concubine of the emperor. The three walked in the bath, and when the Xuanniao fell off his egg, Jian Di took it and swallowed it. The contract was born due to the length of the contract. Zuo Yu had merits in water control.... He was sealed to the Shang and gave the surname Zi. Qi was prosperous in the Tang, Yu, and Dayu periods, and his deeds belonged to the common people, and the common people made peace."

"Qikuo" means clutch. Such as "Poetry. Bei Feng. "Drumming": "Death and life have a broad bond, talk to Zicheng." It means that no matter whether the life or death is separated, it is agreed with the other party. Another example is "The Book of Later Han Dynasty. "Lone Line Biography": "Walking in a hurry, not where Chen Qikuo is, you can go to the front pavilion and stay together, separated by narration."

"Qikuo" also means hard work. Such as "Hou Han Shu. Biography of Wenyuan: "Qi Kuo Suye, unremittingly." Li Xian's note: "Qi Kuo is hard work." "Selected Works. Wei Hongsi "Theory of Game Theory": "Those who have seen fame and fame in ancient and modern times have accumulated unique traces, labored hard, and thoughtful."

"Qikuo" also means to meet and meet. "Three Kingdoms. Wei Shu. "The Biography of Gongsun Yuan" quoted "Wei Lue": "You (Sun) Quandai (Su) Shu, (Sun) Zong, Qi Kuo Wei Qu, the emperor and his ministers are up and down, and Bi Huan is passionate." "Nan Qi Shu. "Zhang Jinger's Biography": "Affection is a great deal, righteousness is broken."
humanum_short_description_en: From "㓞" from " big ". Beginning of the text as "㓞", after the increase " big next to" make " deed " or by " wood next to" make " carve ." Ancient books " carve ", " contract " universal no other. " Deed " means engraving, certificate, agreement, etc.
humanum_full_description:
從「㓞」從「大」。初文作「㓞」，後增「大」旁作「契」，或增「木」旁作「栔」。古書中「栔」、「契」通用無別。參見「㓞」、「栔」。

　　「契」表示刻。《釋名．釋書契》：「契，刻也。刻識其數也。」如《詩．大雅．緜》：「爰始爰謀，爰契我龜。」鄭玄箋：「契灼其龜而卜之。」《呂氏春秋．察今》：「楚人有涉江者，其劍自舟中墜於水，遽契其舟曰：『是吾劍之所從墜。』」

　　「書契」本為古代的一種憑證、信物。一般是一式兩份，在兩件簡牘上都寫上字，又把兩者併在一起，在一側刻上一定數量的齒，由當事雙方各執其一，作為驗對的憑證。（參林澐）《周禮．地官司徒．質人》：「掌稽市之書契，同其度量，壹其淳制。」鄭玄注：「書契，取予市物之券也。其券之象，書兩札，刻其側。」《老子．第七十九章》：「是以聖人執左契而不責於人。」

　　「契」引申表示有契約性質的文書。如《周禮．天官冢宰．小宰》：「六曰聽取予以書契。」又指約定。如《韓詩外傳．卷六》：「約契盟誓，則約定而反無日。」

　　「契」也表示和、合。如《文選．曹子建〈七啟〉》：「玄化參神，與靈合契。」南朝梁簡文帝〈南郊頌〉：「臣聞惟天為大，聖人敬其德，知幾其神，至人契其道。」又指情意相投的人。如東晉陶潛〈桃花源詩〉：「願言躡清風，高舉尋吾契。」

　　「契」是傳說中商人的始祖。《史記．殷本紀》：「殷契，母曰簡狄，有娀氏之女，為帝嚳次妃。三人行浴，見玄鳥墮其卵，簡狄取吞之，因孕生契。契長而佐禹治水有功。……封于商，賜姓子氏。契興於唐、虞、大禹之際，功業著於百姓，百姓以平。」

　　「契闊」表示離合。如《詩．邶風．擊鼓》：「死生契闊，與子成說。」意謂不論死生離合，都和對方約定了。又如《後漢書．獨行列傳》：「行路倉卒，非陳契闊之所，可共到前亭宿息，以敘分隔。」

　　「契闊」也表示勤勞。如《後漢書．文苑列傳》：「契闊夙夜，庶不懈忒。」李賢注：「契闊謂辛苦也。」《文選．韋弘嗣〈博弈論〉》：「歷觀古今功名之士，皆有積累殊異之迹，勞神苦體，契闊勤思。」

　　「契闊」還表示相交、相約。《三國志．魏書．公孫淵傳》注引《魏略》：「又（孫）權待（宿）舒、（孫）綜，契闊委曲，君臣上下，畢歡竭情。」《南齊書．張敬兒傳》：「情存契闊，義著斷金。」
humanum_short_description: 從「㓞」從「大」。初文作「㓞」，後增「大」旁作「契」，或增「木」旁作「栔」。古書中「栔」、「契」通用無別。「契」表示刻、憑證、約定等。
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
契
Pinyin: qì
English Definition: to carve; carved words; to agree; a contract; a deed
Total strokes: 9; Radical: 大
Ideographic: A contract signed by cutting 刀 notches 丰 in wood 木 (now changed to 大)
Character Formation:
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • ⿰ Left to right
      • 丰 [ fēng ] abundant, lush, bountiful, plenty
      • 刀 [ dāo ] knife; old coin; measure
    • 大 [ dà ] big, great, vast, high, deep
Step by Step Stroke Sequence: Download Customize Pin it
Example Words:
契机 [ qì jī ]: opportunity; turning point; juncture
契约 [ qì yuē ]: agreement; contract
默契 [ mò qì ]: tacit understanding; mutual understanding; rapport; connected at a deep level with each other; (of team members) well coordinated; tight
契丹 [ qì dān ]: Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 辽河
契合 [ qì hé ]: agreement; to agree; to get on with; congenial; agreeing with; to ally oneself with sb
More: 契* | *契 | *契*

契契RS deed, contract, bond, engrave
  • RS. a contract 㓞 between men 大
Chinese Definition:
Ideographic: A contract signed by cutting 刀 notches 丰 in wood 木 (now changed to 大)
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • ⿰ Left to right
      • 丰 [ fēng ] abundant, lush, bountiful, plenty
      • 刀 [ dāo ] knife; old coin; measure
    • 大 [ dà ] big, great, vast, high, deep
①证券，证明买卖、抵押、租赁等关系的文书：契约。契据。房契。
②相合，相投：相契。契合。默契。契友。契分(fèn)(投合无间的情分)。契厚。
③用刀雕刻：契刻。契舟求剑。
④(契机)指事物转化的关键。
⑤刻的文字，近代称甲骨文：书契。契文(甲骨文)。
契机 [ qì jī ]: opportunity; turning point; juncture
契约 [ qì yuē ]: agreement; contract
契丹 [ qì dān ]: Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 辽河
契合 [ qì hé ]: agreement; to agree; to get on with; congenial; agreeing with; to ally oneself with sb

Ideographic: A contract signed by cutting 刀 notches 丰 in wood 木 (now changed to 大)

Heisig: Grow up . . . dagger . . . St. Bernard dog. The connotation of this character should be kept distinct from that for vow (Frame 1214) and promise (Frame 1462).
Chinese: Imagine a totalitarian regime where, while growing up, you have to sign contracts and pledge allegiance to the flag at dagger-point with St. Bernard guard dogs watching you and thorny bushes to stop you from running.
koohii1: Imagine a totalitarian regime where, while growing up, you have to pledge allegiance to the flag at dagger-point and with St. Bernard guard dogs watching you.
koohii2: In order to pledge into her sorority, Alice had to stab a St. Bernard with a dagger. (Come on! DO it, Alice!).
Meaning: contract
Story: Imagine a totalitarian regime where, while growing up, you have to sign contracts and pledge allegiance to the flag at dagger-point with St. Bernard guard dogs watching you and thorny bushes to stop you from running.
Kind: both

契機(けいき): opportunity, chance
契る(ちぎる): to pledge, to promise, to swear
契約(けいやく): contract, compact, agreement

從「 㓞 」從「 大 」。初文作「 㓞 」，後增「 大 」旁作「 契 」，或增「 木 」旁作「 栔 」。古書中「 栔 」、「 契 」通用無別。參見「 㓞 」、「 栔 」。 「 契 」表示刻。《釋名．釋書契》：「契，刻也。刻識其數也。」如《詩．大雅．緜》：「爰始爰謀，爰契我龜。」鄭玄箋：「契灼其龜而卜之。」《呂氏春秋．察今》：「楚人有涉江者，其劍自舟中墜於水，遽契其舟曰：『是吾劍之所從墜。』」 「書契」本為古代的一種憑證、信物。一般是一式兩份，在兩件簡牘上都寫上字，又把兩者併在一起，在一側刻上一定數量的齒，由當事雙方各執其一，作為驗對的憑證。（參林澐）《周禮．地官司徒．質人》：「掌稽市之書契，同其度量，壹其淳制。」鄭玄注：「書契，取予市物之券也。其券之象，書兩札，刻其側。」《老子．第七十九章》：「是以聖人執左契而不責於人。」 「 契 」引申表示有契約性質的文書。如《周禮．天官冢宰．小宰》：「六曰聽取予以書契。」又指約定。如《韓詩外傳．卷六》：「約契盟誓，則約定而反無日。」 「 契 」也表示和、合。如《文選．曹子建〈七啟〉》：「玄化參神，與靈合契。」南朝梁簡文帝〈南郊頌〉：「臣聞惟天為大，聖人敬其德，知幾其神，至人契其道。」又指情意相投的人。如東晉陶潛〈桃花源詩〉：「願言躡清風，高舉尋吾契。」 「 契 」是傳說中商人的始祖。《史記．殷本紀》：「殷契，母曰簡狄，有娀氏之女，為帝嚳次妃。三人行浴，見玄鳥墮其卵，簡狄取吞之，因孕生契。契長而佐禹治水有功。……封于商，賜姓子氏。契興於唐、虞、大禹之際，功業著於百姓，百姓以平。」 「契闊」表示離合。如《詩．邶風．擊鼓》：「死生契闊，與子成說。」意謂不論死生離合，都和對方約定了。又如《後漢書．獨行列傳》：「行路倉卒，非陳契闊之所，可共到前亭宿息，以敘分隔。」 「契闊」也表示勤勞。如《後漢書．文苑列傳》：「契闊夙夜，庶不懈忒。」李賢注：「契闊謂辛苦也。」《文選．韋弘嗣〈博弈論〉》：「歷觀古今功名之士，皆有積累殊異之迹，勞神苦體，契闊勤思。」 「契闊」還表示相交、相約。《三國志．魏書．公孫淵傳》注引《魏略》：「又（孫）權待（宿）舒、（孫）綜，契闊委曲，君臣上下，畢歡竭情。」《南齊書．張敬兒傳》：「情存契闊，義著斷金。」

"Three Kingdoms. Wei Shu. 契字的基本解释

契
qì
证券，证明买卖、抵押、租赁等关系的文书：契约。契据。房契。
相合，相投：相契。契合。默契。契友。契分（f坣 ）（投合无间的情分）。契厚。
用刀雕刻：契刻。契舟求剑。
〔契机〕指事物转化的关键。
刻的文字，近代称甲骨文：书契。契文（甲骨文）。

契
qiè
古同“锲”，用刀子刻。

契
xiè
古人名，中国商朝的祖先，传说是舜的臣，助禹治水有功而封于商。

契字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qì］
［《廣韻》苦計切，去霽，溪。］
亦作“栔1”。“挈2”的被通假字。
(1)刻。本谓占卜时以刀凿刻龟甲，后泛指刻物。
(2)指削或割。
(3)刻龟甲的凿子。
(4)泛指雕凿用具。
(5)指刻在甲骨等上的文字。
(6)符节、凭证、字据等信物。古代契分为左右两半，双方各执其一，用时将两半合对以作徵信。后泛指契约。
(7)盟约，要约。
(8)指约定；结盟。
(9)合；投合。
(10)指情意相投的人。
(11)称门下弟子。
(12)指乐声和合、和谐。
(13)契机，关键。
(14)至；达。
(15)体会，领悟。
(16)感通。
(17)绝，断。
(18)量词。犹部或篇。
(19)见“契契”。
[②]［qì］
［《廣韻》去訖切，入迄，溪。］
我国古代少数民族名称用字。
[③]［xiè］
［《集韻》私列切，入薛，心。］
“禼1”的今字。
(1)人名。传说中商的祖先，为帝喾之子。舜时佐禹治水有功，任为司徒，封于商，赐姓子

契字的英文翻译

◎ 契
agree, contract, deed, engrave

契字的康熙字典解释

【丑集下】【大字部】　契； 康熙笔画：9； 页码：页251第21
【廣韻】苦計切【集韻】【韻會】詰計切【正韻】去計切，?音栔。約也。【易·繫辭】上古結繩而治，後世聖人易之以書契。【禮·曲禮】獻粟者執右契。【註】兩書一契，同而別之。　又合也。【周禮·天官】宰夫掌官契以治藏。【前漢·高帝紀】帝與功臣，剖符作誓，丹書鐵契。【唐書·?宗紀】木契銅魚起兵。　又神合也。【神仙傳】魏伯陽作參同契二卷。　又憂苦也。【詩·小雅】契契寤歎。　又灼龜具。【詩·大雅】爰契我龜。【註】契，所以然火而灼之者也。　又怯也。【周禮·冬官考工記·輈人】馬不契需。【註】契，怯。需，懦也。　又姓。見【姓苑】。　又【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】私列切【正韻】先結切。?同?，高辛氏子，舜五臣之一，商之祖也。【書·舜典】帝曰：契，汝作司徒。別作偰?。　又【廣韻】苦結切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】詰結切。?同挈，勤苦也。【詩·邶風】死生契闊。　又疎闊也。【前漢·范丹傳】行路急卒，非?契闊之所。　又刻也。【呂覽】契舟求劒。與鍥通。　又絕也，缺也。【司馬相如·封禪文】陛下

Basic explanation of words
Contract
qì
Securities, documents proving the relationship between buying, selling, mortgage, leasing, etc.: contract. deed. House deed.
Congenial, congenial: congenial. Fit. Tacit understanding. Qiyou. Deed points (f 坣) (combined love points). Qi thick.
Carving with a knife: Qi carved. Qi Zhou asked for a sword.
[Opportunity] refers to the key to the transformation of things.
The engraved text is called Oracle in modern times: book deed. Qiwen (Oracle).
Contract
qiè
Gu Tong "won", carved with a knife.
Contract
xiè
The ancient name, the ancestor of China's Shang Dynasty, is said to be a minister of Shun, who helped Yu to control the waters and was awarded to Shang.
Contract
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qì］
["Guangyun" painstakingly cut, go to Ji, Xi. ]
Also known as "栔1". "挈2" was passed falsely.
(1) Moments. It is said that the tortoise shell is carved with a knife during divination, and later refers to the carved object.
(2) Refers to cutting or cutting.
(3) The chisel for carving the tortoise shell.
(4) Refers to carving tools in general.
(5) Refers to the words engraved on oracle bones.
(6) Symbols, vouchers, handwritings and other tokens. The ancient contract was divided into two halves, each of which held one, and the two halves were paired together for credit investigation. Later refers to the contract.
(7) Covenant, offer.
(8) Refers to an agreement; an alliance.
(9) Close; cast together.
(10) Refers to people who agree with each other.
(11) Called the disciple of the school.
(12) Refers to the harmony and harmony of music.
(13) Opportunity, key.
(14) To; reach.
(15) Experience and comprehend.
(16) Sense of communication.
(17) Absolute, broken.
(18) Quantifiers. Jude or articles.
(19) See "Deed".
[②]［qì］
["Guangyun" goes to the end of the cut, enters the end, the stream. ]
Chinese ancient minority names used characters.
[③]［xiè］
["Jiyun" private column cut, enter Xue, heart. ]
The present character of "禼1".
(1) The name of the person. According to legend, the ancestor of Shang was the son of Emperor Ku. In the reign of Shun, Zuo Yu was good at governing the waters, he was appointed as Situ, sealed to Shang, and given the surname.

Первоначальное слово «чу» похоже на вырезание ножом отметины на бамбуке и дереве.
Стела Ян Тонг: «Стела построена из камня, и Хунли стойкий». Первоначальное значение - «резьба ножом».
Потом добавьте «большой» или «деревянный».

Упрощенные символы
Ци Ци Ци
Продавать
qì, qiè, xie
I qì сущ.
контракт, купчая крепость; условие, соглашение (письменное)
立了一张契 составили купчую
II гл.
1) qì * заключать соглашение, заключать договор (о дружбе), клясться в верности
2) qì сдружиться, сблизиться; знаться, водить компанию с...; дружественный, близкий; скреплённый клятвой, прочный
契兄弟 побратимы
少(shào)与道契 в молодости утвердиться в высоких принципах
3) qì * обжигать
契龟 обжигать черепаховые щиты (для гадания)
4) qiè вырезывать; гравировать
契臂以誓 делали надрезы на плече и кровью скрепляли клятву
5) qiè резать; рассекать, разрубать
III qiè прил.
вм. 怯 (трусливый, малодушный)
IV собств.
1) qì Ци (фамилия)
2) xiè Се (в именах людей)
Radicals: 生, 刀, 大  (life, sword, big)
Meaning Mnemonic
The weight of life on your sword is big when you pledge to protect your city. That's the big, big weight of every single person's life in that city pressing down on you every time you take out that sword.
Imagine holding up your sword and pledging to protect the lives of everyone in this city. It's a big deal!
Reading Mnemonic
Until the city is safe, you pledge to give up cake (けい), your favorite food.
Would you pledge to give up cake to show everyone how serious you are about protecting life?
